Is there a way to split this into multiple smaller changes? If so, we should do that to make sure we don't de-stabilize the code base.

Its a little difficult since there are dependencies all over. One thing
that I can do however is form temporary duplicate directories. For example
corresponding to Wake.Remote I will form Wake.StreamingRemote and once we
are done with reviews replace Wake with this one. Let me know if this seems
fine.

We can check Transport layer, followed by RemoteManager, NetworkService and
Group Communication in that order. First two are Wake and other two are
Network layers. Right now one test is failing in Wake layer and I am trying
to fix it.

[Reef-pull-request-ubuntu #384](https://builds.apache.org/job/Reef-pull-request-ubuntu/384/) UNSTABLE
Looks like there's a problem with this pull request

@bgchun @markusweimer I've answered some comments, and I am in the process of addressing the rest.

Here's one bit of naming I've run into that I need help with. Are we using Resource as a generic term for what in Yarn would be called a Container? It seems Resource is used fairly consistently (e.g. a ResourceStatusEvent maps to the status of a single Yarn Container). However, `RuntimeStatusEvent` uses the term Container -- is this usage a mistake and should be changed to Resource?
This also updates the snapshot from 11 to 92. Is that a way to trick NuGet into accepting as newer than 9?

Wouldn't it be possible to add the support for streaming codecs one layer at a time, starting in Wake? That way, we expand the feature set for the lowest layer, then use that support at the next layer to expand its features and so on. That allows us to focus the review and discussion on a smaller set of changes each time. If this is feasible, please file sub-JIRAs for the various layers.

The naming is inconsistent. Ideally, we'd call it `Evaluator` or `Container`. `Resource` is indeed a term copied over from YARN, which adds confusion in our layer. That said, we shouldn't change the names in this PR and maybe instead file another one. The protocol layer of REEF is in desperate need of a re-think, as it shows a lot of historic relics from the time before Evaluator, Driver and Client had names :-)

One more over-arching comment: Most of the new classes should be annotated with `@DriverSide` and `@RuntimeAuthor` or `@Private` to make their use more easily discoverable. Also, it would be good to add the JCIP annotations for `@ThreadSafe` and `@NotThreadSafe` where appropriate.

I answered my own question by testing it: Yes, it does.

Merging this now.

sure...lemme add separate directory wake.StreamingRemote

@markusweimer @bgchun I'm ready for another review pass, after making the following changes:
- Add comments: For the Builders I mostly added `@see` annotations, because I didn't want to repeat the interface comments (and risk them getting out of sync when additional changes are made).
- Add annotations
- Change file lists to sets
- Removed a diff file had been added by mistake
